intro: Cymodocea filiformis, commonly known as the slender turtle grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as the grass family. This species typically grows in shallow marine environments, such as seagrass beds, where it forms dense underwater meadows. Its leaves are long, narrow, and ribbon-like, often reaching lengths of up to 1 meter. Cymodocea filiformis plays a vital role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
